list_definition.definition: a feeling of dryness (in the mouth) caused by a lack of water or moisture
a strong and eager desire for something
to have a great desire for

list_ex_of_english: Had he been in the recently elected parliament, he would know that it has thirsted for the blood of the commissioners.
The more objects that have been associated with slaking thirst, the more widespread the initial attentional facilitation.
Who can say what would happen if it were known that a great torpedo raid, under officers and crews thirsting for distinction, was levelled against our trade?
The purchasers, thirsting for knowledge, and eager above all things to secure their pound of flesh, are not slow to ply their questions.
The working men for whom this institution was created had a thirst for education in a way we can scarcely any longer imagine today.
We are all thirsting for knowledge.
Fissures opened like parched mouths thirsting for water.
He thirsts for knowledge on these matters.
